Name: Headless Statuette of a Woman
Description: The headless statuette of a woman portrays her standing in the traditional Egyptian style with her arms to her sides and her left foot striding forward. She wears a tight dress that reveals her youthful body contours. A break in the right knee indicates that the dress was very tight. It is evident that the sculptor was much influenced by Greek art and the statuette reflects the start of blending the Egyptian and Hellenistic arts.
